page.title: 06FISHING INDUSTRY
page.content: Although Coverack owes its development to{fishing}and the sea, fishing as an {industry}plays very little part in the life of the village today, and few of the local people earn their living from it.{Shell fish}are caught in pots which used to be made to a traditional design and of local grown withies. Today there are several types of pots made of many different materials, though the trend seems to be back to the original design in modern, more durable materials. Coverack fishermen catch{mackerel} using hooks which are decorated with feathers to attract the fish, having as many as 20 to 25 hooks on a line. {Demersal}fish are caught by nets or by longline. Longlines are lengths of thin rope with a hook every 1.5 fathoms, and may have hundreds of hooks along their lengths.
